intro: Armeria rumelica f. rhodopaea, commonly known as the Rhodope sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Rhodope Mountains in Bulgaria. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are linear and succulent, adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens.
